text: I don't think so, but you can call `ylims!` , etc. inside `lift`.

text:
This is a bit of an evil solution, but you can also do this
```julia> function ylims!(ax::Axis, y1::Node, y2)
           lift(y1) do x
               ylims!(ax, (x, y2))
           end
       end
ylims! (generic function with 7 methods)

julia> function ylims!(ax::Axis, y1, y2::Node)
           lift(y2) do x
               ylims!(ax, (y1, x))
           end
       end
ylims! (generic function with 8 methods)```

elements.text: This is a bit of an evil solution, but you can also do this

julia> function ylims!(ax::Axis, y1::Node, y2)
           lift(y1) do x
               ylims!(ax, (x, y2))
           end
       end
ylims! (generic function with 7 methods)

julia> function ylims!(ax::Axis, y1, y2::Node)
           lift(y2) do x
               ylims!(ax, (y1, x))
           end
       end
ylims! (generic function with 8 methods)
